text: Heya! So sorry for the late reply, my personal message notifications were off for some bizarre reason

That's a really good question and one we're all wondering. I think in the very short term (now and into next month), companies have suspended their hiring. I know that they have because I always like to keep chatting with recruitment haha

I think the filming delays will have an effect but not as big as everyone is thinking. Once companies have their remote work sorted out (which is starting to all be cleared up) I think it opens the door to start thinking about new hires. If you're graduating in May you're right in that gray area I think. If there's an upturn and people are starting to go back to the studios, then you're in a prime position.

My advice is treat yourself as if Corona isn't a thing. Make sure your reel is ready, you've got your CV written up, and you're starting to make companies aware that you're on the lookout. That way you're not on the backfoot when suddenly they want everyone to start applying again
